name: The Vernal Chapel
tagline: Colonies of doves roost in groves of silver birch, cooing psalm-like, communal melodies.

procedural.foraging_results: Successful foraging yields 1d3 portions of Worm-Mallow (p430), in addition to the normal results

description: Colonies of doves roost in groves of silver birch, cooing psalm-like, communal melodies.

points_of_interest.name: Ruined Chapel
points_of_interest.description: At the centre of a fern-decked glade stands the forsaken ruin of a chapel, its spire toppled in a heap of stones.
points_of_interest.entering: An ancient oaken door is held ajar by a thicket of ground creepers. Its exterior is pitted with numerous old, humanoid claw marks.
points_of_interest.interior: Smashed pews and floral columns, overwhelmed with ivy and mould. Queen Incantral (blood wyrm—DMB) lairs here, coiled around the altar, protecting her eggs—five blood-red sacs glued to the altar.
points_of_interest.exploring: A sturdy, locked door behind the altar—cleared of ivy—leads to a narrow stair to the Chapel Crypt.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Queen Incantral (blood wyrm) lairs here, protecting her eggs. 3 Level 1 hunters hide in the trees around the glade.
special_features: Charmed hunters ambush trespassers (3-in-6 chance of surprise)
Five blood-red egg sacs glued to altar
Cleared door leads to Chapel Crypt

points_of_interest.name: Chapel Crypt
points_of_interest.description: A dank space, streaked with mould. Against the far wall sits an altar, surrounded by the mounded hoard of Incantral. Lying pristine atop the altar is the lost Sword of St Sedge.
points_of_interest.entering: Accessed via narrow stair from cleared door behind altar in Ruined Chapel
points_of_interest.interior: A dank space, streaked with mould. Against the far wall sits an altar, surrounded by the mounded hoard of Incantral.
points_of_interest.exploring: 7 ghouls stand paralysed at the crypt's perimeter, poised to strike the altar. They are paralysed by the sword's magic, but could be awoken by Dispel Magic.
special_features: Sword of St Sedge on altar
7 frozen ghouls paralysed by sword magic

npcs.name: Queen Incantral
npcs.title: Lady of the Table Downs
npcs.description: A mature blood wyrm with a regal visage of great beauty and humanity, aside from bulbous cerulean eyes, faceted like diamonds. Rows of purple blisters pulsate upon her belly.
demeanor: protectiveness can flare to ferocious violence
desires: To protect her clutch of eggs
possessions: Key to the Chapel Crypt, hung on a neck-antler

items.name: The Sword of St Sedge
items.description: A gleaming Holy Longsword (Holy Radiance, p412) imbued with sentience. Decorated with a scintillating chrysoberyl on the pommel and raindrop engravings along the blade.
demeanor: obsessed with the myths of St Sedge
desires: To be reunited with the lost shield and helm of St Sedge
items.mechanical_effect: Non-Lawful creatures suffer 1d6 damage per Round when touching. Lawful character who possesses must Save Versus Spell or come under Holy Quest to achieve sword's desires

items.name: The Wyrm's Hoard
items.description: Coins: 20,225gp, 958pp. 2 arcane scrolls: One of Ingratiate, Web, and Teleport. A second of Shield of Force and Perceive the Invisible. Magic items: A dented brass Ring of Energy Resistance (Fire, p410). A vial of Philtre of the Winds (p414). An Arcane Shortsword (Werebane, p412) with a wolf's head pommel and a wolf-fur sheath.

secrets: History of the Sword of St Sedge: Taking vows of peace and poverty in his retirement, Sedge bequeathed his magic sword to the keeping of the nuns of the Vernal Chapel. Many years later, a horde of undead descended from the nearby Table Downs, sacked the chapel, and slew the nuns. A young nun, Gryselde, guarded the sword with her life. Her spirit lives on in the blade, granting it sentience.
dm_notes: Queen Incantral has vulnerability to water. The helm of St Sedge is in hex 0408 and the shield may be placed by the Referee as desired.
